segment.source: Monitor the central access policies that apply on a file server (Windows 10)
segment.target: Monitor the central access policies that apply on a file server (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to the central access policies that apply to a file server when using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to the central access policies that apply to a file server when using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.

segment.source: Monitor the central access policies that apply on a file server
segment.target: Monitor the central access policies that apply on a file server

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to the central access policies that apply to a file server when using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to the central access policies that apply to a file server when using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.

segment.source: Central access policies are created on a domain controller and then applied to file servers through Group Policy management.
segment.target: Central access policies are created on a domain controller and then applied to file servers through Group Policy management.

segment.source: Use the following procedures to configure and verify security auditing settings that are used to monitor changes to the set of central access policies on a file server.
segment.target: Use the following procedures to configure and verify security auditing settings that are used to monitor changes to the set of central access policies on a file server.

segment.source: The following procedures assume that you have configured and deployed dynamic access control, including central access policies, and claims in your network.
segment.target: The following procedures assume that you have configured and deployed dynamic access control, including central access policies, and claims in your network.

segment.source: If you have not yet deployed dynamic access control in your network, see Deploy a Central Access Policy (Demonstration Steps).
segment.target: If you have not yet deployed dynamic access control in your network, see Deploy a Central Access Policy (Demonstration Steps).

segment.source: To configure settings to monitor changes to central access policies
segment.target: To configure settings to monitor changes to central access policies

segment.source: Sign in to your domain controller by using domain administrator credentials.
segment.target: Sign in to your domain controller by using domain administrator credentials.

segment.source: In Server Manager, point to Tools, and then click Group Policy Management.
segment.target: In Server Manager, point to Tools, and then click Group Policy Management.

segment.source: In the console tree, right-click the flexible access Group Policy Object, and then click Edit.
segment.target: In the console tree, right-click the flexible access Group Policy Object, and then click Edit.

segment.source: Double-click Computer Configuration, double-click Security Settings, double-click Advanced Audit Policy Configuration, double-click Policy Change, and then double-click Other Policy Change Events.
segment.target: Double-click Computer Configuration, double-click Security Settings, double-click Advanced Audit Policy Configuration, double-click Policy Change, and then double-click Other Policy Change Events.

segment.source: Note: This policy setting monitors policy changes that might not be captured otherwise, such as central access policy changes or trusted platform module configuration changes.
segment.target: Note: This policy setting monitors policy changes that might not be captured otherwise, such as central access policy changes or trusted platform module configuration changes.

segment.source: Select the Configure the following audit events check box, select the Success check box (and the Failure check box, if desired), and then click OK.
segment.target: Select the Configure the following audit events check box, select the Success check box (and the Failure check box, if desired), and then click OK.

segment.source: After you modify the central access policies on the domain controller, verify that the changes have been applied to the file server and that the proper events are logged.
segment.target: After you modify the central access policies on the domain controller, verify that the changes have been applied to the file server and that the proper events are logged.

segment.source: To verify changes to the central access policies
segment.target: To verify changes to the central access policies

segment.source: Sign in to your domain controller by using domain administrator credentials.
segment.target: Sign in to your domain controller by using domain administrator credentials.

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management Console.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management Console.

segment.source: Right-click Default domain policy, and then click Edit.
segment.target: Right-click Default domain policy, and then click Edit.

segment.source: Double-click Computer Configuration, double-click Policies, and then double-click Windows Settings.
segment.target: Double-click Computer Configuration, double-click Policies, and then double-click Windows Settings.

segment.source: Double-click Security Settings, right-click File system, and then click Manage CAPs.
segment.target: Double-click Security Settings, right-click File system, and then click Manage CAPs.

segment.source: In the wizard that appears, follow the instructions to add a new central access policy (CAP), and then click OK.
segment.target: In the wizard that appears, follow the instructions to add a new central access policy (CAP), and then click OK.

segment.source: Use local administrator credentials to sign in to the server that hosts resources that are subject to the central access policies you changed.
segment.target: Use local administrator credentials to sign in to the server that hosts resources that are subject to the central access policies you changed.

segment.source: Press the Windows key + R, then type cmd to open a Command Prompt window.
segment.target: Press the Windows key + R, then type cmd to open a Command Prompt window.

segment.source: Note: If the User Account Control dialog box appears, confirm that the action it displays is what you want, and then click Yes.
segment.target: Note: If the User Account Control dialog box appears, confirm that the action it displays is what you want, and then click Yes.

segment.source: Type gpupdate /force, and press ENTER.
segment.target: Type gpupdate /force, and press ENTER.

segment.source: In Server Manager, click Tools, and then click Event Viewer.
segment.target: In Server Manager, click Tools, and then click Event Viewer.

segment.source: Expand Windows Logs, and then click Security.
segment.target: Expand Windows Logs, and then click Security.

segment.source: Verify that event 4819 appears in the security log.
segment.target: Verify that event 4819 appears in the security log.

segment.source: Related resource
segment.target: Related resource

segment.source: Using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects
segment.target: Using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects
